subject: Re: [junit] Unit testing Exception classes
msgSnippet: James Abley wrote:  ... Jakarta commons lang contains an Exception class that may do the job. That s what we used before switching to 1.4. It uses the
messageBody:
James Abley wrote:
<snip>

>I haven't really thought this one through or written any Learning Tests, but
>considering only checked Exceptions for now, is there any reason you haven't
>got a base class that extends Exception and provides all 1.3 and earlier and
>1.4 and later exception chaining that you might need? I'm in the camp that
>doesn't need to worry about running on anything earlier than 1.4, but I
>think I've seen other code somewhere that had done something like that to
>provide this functionality.
>
>
>
Jakarta commons lang contains an Exception class that may do the job.
That's what we used before switching to 1.4. It uses the same interface
as the 1.4 classes for chaining.

- Neil
